qas.question: To what does congress attempt to limit executive officials?
What court case affirmed the mandates of the first and seventh sections of Article I of the Constitution?
When was INS v Chadha tried before the Supreme Court?
By what margin can congress over ride a Presidential veto?
Who often writes laws to restrain Congress to the performance of their duties?
In which case did Congress decide that all powers would be vested in the Supreme Court consisting of a Senate and House of Representatives?

plausible_answers.text: Senate and a House of Representatives

qas.question: Congress decide that all powers would be vested in the Supreme Court consisting of a which two bodies?
In what year did Congress decide that all powers would be vested in the Supreme Court consisting of a Senate and House of Representatives?
Who must be presented with every bill passed by the President?

context: Congress often writes legislation to restrain <b4_0>executive officials<b4_0/> to <a0_0>the performance of their duties<a0_0/>, as laid out by the laws Congress passes. In <a1_0><b5_0>INS v. Chadha<b5_0/><a1_0/> (<a2_0><b7_0>1983<b7_0/><a2_0/>), the Supreme Court decided (a) The prescription for legislative action in Art. I, § 1—requiring all legislative powers to be vested in a Congress consisting of a <b6_0>Senate and a House of Representatives<b6_0/>—and § 7—requiring every bill passed by <b8_0>the House and Senate<b8_0/>, before becoming law, to be presented to the president, and, if he disapproves, to be repassed by <a3_0>two-thirds<a3_0/> of the Senate and House—represents the Framers' decision that the legislative power of the Federal Government be exercised in accord with a single, finely wrought and exhaustively considered procedure. This procedure is an integral part of the constitutional design for the separation of powers. Further rulings clarified the case; even both Houses acting together cannot override Executive vetos without a 2⁄3 majority. Legislation may always prescribe regulations governing executive officers.
